result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in court with Attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  33  MONTHS with Zero days credit, consecutive to any other sentence -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  17  MONTHS  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  16   MONTHS

Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
No contact with the victim

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms
ORDER TO PRODUCE

Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to count 1 as charged:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Court orders counts 2,3,4, dismissed and read in for sentencing on 10-7-2015.  Defendant remanded.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defense counsel is requesting a plea/sentencing date of 9-24-2015 at 8:15.  ADA Heitman to do OTP from DCI for defendant.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 10-14-2015 at 08:15 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 11-16-2015 at 8:15 a.m.

Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court, defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing and requests adjournment for trial.
State's motion to join cases for purposes of trial, no objection by defense counsel, granted by the Court.  Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 4.
Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
Clerk:  jms

Signed and filed, No Contact/NO FIREARMS Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VIVIAN W.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant HAS A LOWER PENDING CASE AND is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
